definition: to come prepared
to have/there is/there are/to exist/to be
variant of 備|备[bei4]
to prepare/get ready/to provide or equip
and/as well as/and so/but (not)/yet (not)/(indicates causal relation)/(indicates change of state)/(indicates contrast)
to come/to arrive/to come round/ever since/next

sentences.english: They come well prepared. They study hard and they succeed.
sentences.chinese: 他们有备而来，学习努力，并且获得成功。

sentences.english: They are well prepared and never improvise.
sentences.chinese: 他们总是有备而来，从不临时行事。

sentences.english: Issue an agenda so attendees can come prepared.
sentences.chinese: 发布一份议程表，让与会者有备而来。

sentences.english: Japanese army prepared and trapped some main jerked a spring mountain positions.
sentences.chinese: 日军有备而来，晁猛地主力一团被困清泉山阵地。

sentences.english: It seems that you are well prepared.

definition: grasp it and victory is assured/to have success within one's grasp (idiom)
see 胸有成竹[xiong1 you3 cheng2 zhu2]
to be determined to win (idiom)
He who comes is surely ill-intentioned, no-one well-meaning will come (idiom)./Be careful not to trust foreigners./Beware of Greeks bearing gifts!
pinyin: lai2 zhe3 bu4 shan4 , shan4 zhe3 bu4 lai2

definition: certain/to know for sure
to plan in advance (idiom)/a card up one's sleeve/forewarned is forearmed
to wait at one's ease for the exhausted enemy/to nurture one's strength and bide one's time (idiom)
the whole nest came out (idiom); to turn out in full strength
to be a cinch/in the bag/(of a person) confident of success
to miscalculate/miscalculation
exactly what one wants
(in the negative) (not) to be trifled with
everything bodes ill, no positive signs (idiom); inauspicious/everything points to disaster
to gain the initiative by striking first (idiom); to preempt/to anticipate/preemptive
to catch an enemy off guard with a surprise attack (idiom, from Sunzi's "The Art of War" 孫子兵法|孙子兵法[Sun1 zi3 Bing1 fa3])
pinyin: chu1 qi2 bu4 yi4 , gong1 qi2 bu4 bei4

definition: to be assured of success
